Summary Excellent problem solver wanting to make an impact in technology industry. Experienced at adapting to new situations and delivering results, creating innovative solutions to resolve product and process inefficiencies, capable of influencing senior management and motivating cross functional teams to improve organizational efficiency. 
  
Deep understanding of strategic decision making, software and hardware product development, and how technology is influencing the way we live, work and play. Curious about what is possible in the future and how businesses can help shape a better world. 
  
Key experiences include leading a strategic planning and implementation efforts for a microprocessor design extension, launching a successful first-of-its-kind product, creating an innovative solution to eliminate manual work at Intel, driving process overhaul to improve consumer perceptions at Dell, mentoring new members such as interns, new-grads and MBA candidates. Summary I am a software developer and technical generalist with a diverse scientific and engineering educational background. 
Despite my relative inexperience, I've held positions in businesses large (50,000+ employees) and small (15 employees). I have directed my own success in freelance projects and been an ongoing member of an academic research team for more than 3 years. My duties in these positions have been primarily in programming, but I have experience in sales and customer service as well. 
 
Some of my favorite projects include: making an immersive 3D MRI viewer using the Unity Game engine and the Oculus Rift, creating a full stack(in PHP, SQL, js, html5) modern web-app for medical patient care, and writing a simulation of Pogonomyrmex Barbatus (Red Harvester Ant) foraging behavior using a agent-based modeling and finite state machines. I've also hacked around with small-scale computers like the raspberry pi and embedded systems like the arduino. 
 
Most recently I've been using docker to help with painless deployment of my Bioinformatics programs and databases. Summary I am a software developer and technical generalist with a diverse scientific and engineering educational background.

Experience Undergraduate Technical Intern Intel Corporation May 2015  –  August 2015  (4 months) Santa Clara Worked on the Bus Interface Unit (BIU) Validation team for the Knights Hill (KNH) Supercomputer.  
- Worked on the BUS unit of the pipeline. The BUS unit comprised an L2 cache shared by two cores. This entire cache+dual core node was connected to other identical nodes in a mesh interconnect. 
- Ported content and code to be used in formal verification from the KNL (predecessor of KNH) to KNH compatible code 
- Debugged failing assertions using the formal verification tool, JasperGold.  
- Wrote a SystemVerilog checker to check the correctness of a security feature. The security feature was used to control access to system resources like control registers, policy registers and shared memory. 
- Wrote a SystemVerilog checker to check that bit conversions in the Security Attribute Initiator (SAI) were happening correctly. Had to deal with out-of-order requests coming in and therefore, required an ID table to map correct conversion inputs to its corresponding request.
